page.title: 16HULL:PATTERNS OF EMPLOYMENT
page.content: For many years fishing lay at the heart of employment in Hull, with many families employed directly as fishermen or indirectly in fishing related industries. This is no longer the case. Only 1% of children in our school had a parent involved in fishing. Another 1% had fathers who worked at sea - usually connected with the off-shore oil industry. Much of the heavy engineering in the city has also disappeared. Only 5% of children had a parent involved in one of the skilled trades. Most full-time employment amongst fathers was connected with service industries. As many as 12% had a father who drove a vehicle - lorries, buses etc. Part-time work amongst mothers was most often directed towards cleaning, home-helps, dinner ladies etc.
